title: Similar fonts to Maniackers 232MKSD Round Light
content:
Hi all,

I'm looking for fonts similar to :

[232MKSD Round Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/www2.wind.ne.jp/maniackers/232mksd.html)

Its for a military interface for a game set a decade or two in the future. 232MKSD has the right kind of aesthetic but I'm open to completely different suggestions.

Plus's :

Its compressed (always useful for game interfaces). The bowls are vertical, c, e etc. Its legible at small sizes and has large open counters. The stroke weight is even so it will reproduce well on screen.

Minus's:

Needs to be a slightly heavier weight. It is rounded which is too friendly for a military theme. I would like to try a more angular version like a condensed :

[jillican](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/jillican/).

Thanks in advance for any suggestions, this site is such a great resource for type.
author: AngelFlonne

comments.content:
Maybe too rounded: [Isonorm](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/isonorm/), [Din condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-din-text-comp-pro/). Maybe have a look at daFont.com for ideas too?

You saw that the 232D font has three weights, right?

That's funny, I tried DIN condensed :)

Isonorm is a bit rounded and doesn't really have the modern graphic feel I'm looking for. I found another font that was interesting on a leaflet, I'm going to post it to the Type ID board for identification, could be a contender.

Cheers.

Strange it hasn't come up yet, how about United from Tal Leming, available from House Ind.

[http://typesupply.com/portfolio/typefaces/united/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/typesupply.com/portfolio/typefaces/united/ "http://typesupply.com/portfolio/typefaces/united/")  
 [http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection "http://www.houseind.com/fonts/unitedcollection")

Military lettering inspired? √  
Oodles of widths and weights? √  
Comes in Sans and Serif? √  
Yes but does it have a Stencil version? √ of course dude!  
Is the Dollar cheap at the moment? √ is it ever!

--Kai

Have you looked at any of the fonts from [Identikal](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/identikal/fonts/?sort=abc#return_to_item_44) on MyFonts.com?

These three come to mind after reading your brief.  
 [45 Degrees](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-identikal/45-degrees/)  
 [Tremble](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fw-identikal/tremble/)  
 [UNDA](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/unda/)

You could also try searching on MyFonts for [Miltary](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/military/fonts/) and [Futuristic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/futuristic/fonts/).

Thanks all, those are excellent recommendations. CreativeNRG, your recommendations are all spot on though I didn't shortlist any because I think they would be a little less legible at the smaller sizes, it will get compressed a lot and the quality really deteriorates in game. United is a very good contender but I have a complaint about House Industries site, its virtually impossible to sample fonts so makes it really difficult to evaluate against those from myfonts.com which have excellent sampling options.

For your interest I think we've narrowed it to Quantico, Jillican, Milibus, CA Monodon, Coupe and Baksheesh from Myfonts.com, Blender Pro from Gestalten and United from House Industries. They're mostly condensed, octagonal and I think they have a military geometric aesthetic.

Thanks again everyone.

\> _its virtually impossible to sample fonts so makes it really difficult to evaluate_

it is? have you seen the lettersetter?

[http://www.houseind.com/t/7a3cf6](http://web.archive.org/web/20140723083535/http:/www.houseind.com/t/7a3cf6 "http://www.houseind.com/t/7a3cf6")

—Kai
Yes, unless I'm mistaken you can set one or two words against a picture background only. Virtually useless to me compared to myfonts.com. I can't even set the exact size unless I'm missing something.
